summary: Email correspondence between attorney Sigrid McCawley and an unnamed client regarding legal strategy in the Epstein case, specifically discussing letters rogatory for depositions and cautioning the client about attorney-client privilege when communicating with family and witnesses.

keyFacts: Defendants in the Epstein case were seeking letters rogatory to depose witnesses, and the judge was likely to allow depositions of anyone with relevant information.
Attorney Sigrid McCawley warned her client not to discuss case details with family or witnesses to avoid waiving attorney-client privilege.
The client expressed concern about not being able to contact their entire family and mentioned a 10-year relationship with an unnamed individual.
The document reveals active legal strategy discussions between attorneys and clients regarding witness depositions in the Epstein litigation.
